Incident.Summary: Single-vehicle PI Collision. Driver was arrested for DUI / DWI.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Single-Vehicle Collision. This incident was recorded on Mobile Video Recorder installed in H-26 and TFC Thomas Body Worn Camera. Driver: Nia Danielle Rooney, AA/F, DOB: 05/09/1998 Maryland SDX: R-500-630-135-354 Address: 5005 Box Turtle Ct., Indian Head, MD 20640 Vehicle: MD 4FF5044 2021 Kia K5 Location: S/B Route 224 S/O Campbell Bowman Place Training and Certificates: Trained and certified in administering the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests through the Maryland State Police and the National Highway Safety Administration. Completed LIDAR and RADAR training through the Maryland State Police. Completed Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E) training in June 2019. Completed Crisis Intervention Training in September 2020. Distinguished Graduate of the Maryland Highway Safety Office and University of Maryland DUI Institute in July 2022. Narrative: PHASE 1 VEHICLE IN MOTION On 04/02/2023, at approximately 2330 hours, I responded to a single-vehicle collision on southbound Route 224, south of Campbell Bowman Place, Indian Head, Charles County, Maryland. Once I arrived on scene, I observed a gray Kia K5 bearing Maryland Registration 4FF5044 in the roadway with heavy front-end damage. I also observed the driver sitting in the driver seat looking for items inside of her vehicle. All airbags were deployed in the vehicle. I further observed a Verizon telephone pole being sheared in half by the collision. A witness on scene advised, the vehicle was driving erratically, crossed the centerline and struck the telephone. PHASE 2 PERSONAL CONTACT I made contact with the female driver and asked how the collision occurred. The driver seemed disoriented and confused and stated she was driving home and blacked out. She then stated she woke up and saw people walking around. I immediately detected the odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath and her eyes where bloodshot and glassy. Her speech was slow and slurred. I further observed the drivers shirt was ripped open with her breasts exposed. The driver also had a 3-inch cut above her right eye. The EMS personnel stated they would take her to the University of Maryland Charles Regional Medical Center (UMCRMC), 5 Garrett Ave, La Plata, MD 20646 to assess the wound. I advised the driver that I would come to the hospital to further complete my investigation. The driver was identified by her Maryland Drivers License as Nia Danielle Rooney (AA/F, DOB: 05/09/1998). Rooney was transported to UMCRMC by Paramedic Ambulance 209. PHASE 3 PRE-ARREST SCREENING I arrived at UMCRMC and spoke with the EMS personnel. They advised Rooney was extremely intoxicated on the ride to the hospital. The charge nurse on duty also stated he saw visible signs of impairment. I asked Rooney if she consumed any alcoholic beverages that night and Rooney responded by saying, Yes, I had endless Mimosas in Arlington and was driving home. I then asked, When did you stop drinking the Mimosas? and Rooney responded by saying, A while ago before I drove home. Rooney further mentioned she had been drinking since 1500 that evening. I could smell the strong odor of the alcoholic beverage emitting from her breath. Due to her injuries, I could not conduct Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (Could Not Conduct Due to Injuries) WALK AND TURN (Could Not Conduct Due to Injuries) ONE LEG STAND (Could Not Conduct Due to Injuries) Based on my training, knowledge and experience as a Maryland State Trooper and in making DUI and DWI arrests, Rooneys slow, slurred speech, bloodshot glassy eyes, her admittance to consuming alcohol with her disoriented demeanor, I believed Rooney was too impaired to operate a motor vehicle which contributed to the vehicle collision. At 0103 hours, I placed Rooney under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol. While at UMCRMC, Rooney was read her DR-15, Advice of Rights on 04/03/2023 at 0119 hours. Rooney was read and explained the form, and asked if she had any questions. Rooney responded by saying, No. At 0126 hours, Rooney refused to submit to a Maryland State Police Blood Kit. Rooney was given all appropriate paperwork and citations and released to the care and custody of the medical personnel. Charges: TA 21-902(a1i) Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol TA 21-902(b1i) Driving While Impaired by Alcohol TA 21-901.1(b) Negligent Driving TA 21-901.1(a) Reckless Driving margin-bottom:11px">TA 21-801(b) Failure to Control Vehicle Speed to Avoid Collision All events occurred in Charles County, MD. Case Closed.
